div.p: Clear lovely day – Florence left at 1 1/2 Train for Worcester – after wh. I took Ellen + Mary Chapin to ride in sliegh + then Mrs Beane —
Annie Emerson called + I then called on Mrs Metcalf– Eve. Benj Braman called –
Hazy day– Nellie quite unwell– I at Desk morng. + P.M. till I went to Prep. Lecture –– Mr + Mrs Ed. Freeman + Mrs Luty Freeman voted into the Chh.
Eve Sam. Draper + Mrs Wild called + S. White –
Thaw — very hazy + some dripping — Snow meltg fast — Forenoon I cleared out upper draw – Geo. Sweet called – about the colt
Eve. – Ins. letter for S. A. Williams—
Clear + bright — morng. puttering – Sewed Some on Machine —
P.M. Danl. Cobb. calld to get pay for Bills — after which I drove Blackie with Mrs B. + M. News of Wm. B. Sawyer's death on 31. ult–
Bright morng. but soon overcast. and P.M. very rainy Mr Atkinson's morg text– Heb. 12–28 – The stability of Christ's Kingdom –very good – P.M. Com. Season —
Mrs Luty Freeman with Mr + Mrs Ed. Freeman recd. into the Chh.
Geo. went to Taunton in noon Train. Mrs B. + I drove out in Sliegh – Icy Eve. We went to vesty to prayer meeting. 8 men all told present — good meeting

div.opener:
8° a.0. Week of Prayer
Tuesday, January 7, 1873.
div.p: Pleasant – no wind Mrs B. + I walked to P.O. to the Atkinsons to Cottage – Bd. House + then Home – P.M to Chh.
a letter from Samy Chapin + Sister Mary —
Hazy –morng. read + Sewed – P.M. drove round Chartly Sq. in Sliegh with Mrs Bean –
Eve. at home at Desk–
Mild + beautiful day – Mrs B. + I went to P.M. prayer meeting at vestry – Eve. cold Mr Rogerson spoke of his Early conversion
Clear + cold – Mrs Bean + I went to Boston – I did considerable business – out in 4 1/2 Train –
a letter from Martha
vry cold – Tired from yesterdays tramp Looked after Sundry things – in morng. Read papers —
P.M. took a nap.

Pleasant but cold– Mr Atkinson read in morng. Eccls. 3 chp – text 12 v– on man's fitting well the place God appoints for him – it being the way to honor God. – P.M —2 1. Cor 15. 58 — Mrs B + I went out in the too – Nellie in the P M.
Pleasant– called at Cottage + on Mrs Metcalf
Geo. took Monte Cristo to Lane Bros. to Slaughtr
Very Mild– Mrs B. + Nillie went to Bos. to see Dr Clarke—
I went in P.M. to Cottage to carry Teaspoons +c for Sociable – Eve I went there– pleasing gathering– Dr Clarks dicesion favorable about Nellie,s lungs—
Cloudy + very raw — Forenoon busy about Storerooms +c. + reading Adverstiser – P.M. nap &ddotlow; in my Chair – havg had sleepless night last night —
Eve. heard Les Mis–
Very icy still
P.M. Settled with Charley Lane –
Eve. so icy we did not go to meeting– Heard reading – Les Mis.
Rainy– drizzly day–
Mrs Beane getting sick from vaccination I slept little last night–
P.M. Miss Mellus + Carter called + we walked on Piazza–
Eve. heard Les Mis"—
Still stormy – hail + rain– Mr Frank. Holmes came just at breakfast + left in 11 1/4 Train– I was vry glad to see him. Mrs Beane sick with vaccination
Raw day– Georgy took Maggie to Chh.
I was alone from my family in morng. to hear Dr Blodgett fr. Jer. 29– 10–13 – P.M. Nellie went May – cold – Mrs B. vac. n Mr Akinson Sick with crick– P.M. text Matt. 5–14 – Mag. Sick at Eve.
Pleasant – morng. I went to P.O. + was busy about Sundry things expctg Ella Norcross to dine but She stillwent to Bos. in illegible11 1/4 train – P.M. took Mellus, Carter + Ellen to ride –
Eve. heard "Les Mis. read –
Cloudy– P.M. drove out with Misses Smith Stanton + Ellen — roud Chartly Sq– then to Bridgetts + paid for washing
Pleasant—
P.M. I drove to Attle taking Mrs Wild, Mrs Babbitt, there + Nellie to Lenas Carpenter's I found Carrie Smith had failed much Since I last saw her—
Eve— heard reading
Very lovely winter day &wavlin; Geo. went to Taunton to see about Selling Hay — I drove out in forenoon to Issac . Blandins + John Calvin Crans – Miss Mellus + other drove P.M.
Eve. Gen. Chamberlain lectured on Lee's surrend
A Storm of Sleet + Snow all day – We kept house Except Mary Chapin – Dr Cullis addressed the School — at Eve.
Pleasant– morng. I went to office – + Cottage – Geo. went to Taunton about Hay + Manure —
Rev. Mrs Roberts of Auburndale preached Mr Atkinson not being well – morng. text 2 Chron. 5 – 12–13– on praising God – P.M. Isa. Smoking flax he will not quench +c – I out twice
Storming all day — Mary out to School duties —
We read Les Miserables considerable – I cut out 3 night dresses –
Eve. a paper that told me of Cousin Ann B. Baylies death ag &ddotlow; 80 yrs on 17&th; inst–
Most lovely day –
Mrs B. Nellie + I walk. as far as James Wrigleys + then to Parsonage – calling at Cottage — Finished Les Miser–
Sewed on night dress some — Geo. gone to Raynham – about wheels –
very cold—
P.M went to Mrs Atkinson to Sew for Missoins
at 9 1/2 O clk Eve. it was 12° below 0.

at 6, 'o'ck it was 22d below 0 — + continued So for near 2 hrs[scribbled small] at noot 24° abov – 1 1/2 26° above – beautiful day— Fast Day for Collegs Mrs Beane addressed the School – Geo. went to Boston to get wheels for drawg hay –

at 7, o clk – at 3 P.M. 48° Very lovely day — Mrs Bean and Maggie went to Taunton. to buy goods for Maggy – May with Class had Sligh ride to Taunton – Fem. prayer meeting here. Nellie + I rode out with Mr Wild a little way —
Pleasant tho. rathr raw wind – P.M. I took Nellie to Lenas Carpenters for a visit – Mary went with me in sliegh.
4° a. d Quite cold but fair weather — Mr Atkinson gave the peoples Severe reproofs for delinquincies — I out all day + Eve.
but went up to 35° by 1 P.M. drove out to shoemakers with Miss Carter + Mrs Beane + after took Miss Mellus —
Weather moderated + sprinkling some — Churing done this morg. 3lbs 8oz

3o'clk. P.M. 53° a.b.zero– Snow melting rapidly – Forenoon went to P.O. + then looked after fruit[?]– Geo. went to Taunton about wheels — P.M. I drove out with Mrs Metcalf + Miss Smith — Dr Round vaccinated Mary[unclear] + me again — Mr Cougdon's lecture on Journalism —
Pleasant + mild — I oiled Sewing Machine + Sundry things —
P.M. at Desk on &account; — Letter from Susie Pratt. Mrs Metcalf + her friend Miss Carrie Smith here to Tea —
Subscribed for Picturesque America
Lovely day — Mrs B. + I drove to No. Dighton to see Rosey Retd about 2 P.M. after dinner I called on Mrs Taft who is sick on Lizzie Wild + Mrs Bowen Wetherd —
after dinner Mrs B. + I went to Lenas Carpenter for Nellie —
P.M. Female prayer meeting — Mrs + Miss Atkinson + Mrs Barrows here to Tea + Rev. Mr Atkinson also — Raind hard + they want to Semy to hear Mr Mc Elroy —
Pleasant– Rode in forenoon with Mrs B. Nellie + Miss Carter — P.M. Miss Mellus had Blky to ride —
at tea time Susie Pratt came to pass the Sabbath —
Rather mild in morng. but grew raw + chilly I went to Chh. in morng. + staid to S.S. but kept in doors the rest of the day — at eve. it grew very windy + very cold —
But last night was the most tedious of the season to keep the house warm — It moderated today — Susie left in P.M. to return to Brookline to her school = Mary Chapin at home here on act. of cold —

+ moderated all day — I kept hous from a cold — Miss Mellus + Carter + Nellie drove to Oliver Clapps. P.M. Geo. drov wood for Mr Tripp (I suppose Eve. Nellie gone with graduating class to Mrs Atkinsons to Tea
Dull day — Mrs Babbit here sewing for Margaret I plied the Machine P.M. went out to ride with Mrs Bea + Nellie Eve. wrote sister Ema.
Mary some better— Did not go to meeting Eve. Mr + Mrs Atkinson called to see how we were —
Eve. We went to Semy to hear Rev James W. Strong D.D. Past. Carlton College. He spent the night here.
Pleasant. Dr Strong left in 11 1/4 Train –

P.M. I drove out to Sam. Draper's – with Mary + Nellie — + at Depot at 3 P.M. found Florence from Worcester for a week's vacation — Eve. Mrs Beane + I went to Ed. Free[trails off] to talk over soc. matters —
Not pleasant – snowed– I staid at noon —
Mr Atkinson's morng. text Enock walked with God P.M. 2 Cor. 4–18– very good. Night howling + storm of snow —
Very stormy mong. but cleared in P.M. I called Mary Atkinsons Door— + on Mrs Rogers + Barrows —
At Desk consideraby
Eve. heard read
Lovely day —
at desk + reading papers — + wrote Sam — Mary went to school for the first time for more then a week.
David Holman called after dinner to say that Caroline Smith dyed this morng. at 3 o'clock at Saml. Holmes very foggy — —
P.M. Geo. drove to Poor House to order Hearse. Florence, Ellen + I rode with him.
Eve. Mrs B. + I went to meetig

Cloudy till about 2 P.M. when it began snowing very fast + violently We went to Uni. Chh. at 2 to attend the funeral of Caroline Smith — Mrs Atkinson officiated — Maggie went to Taunton Eve. We finished reading Robert Falconer by Geo. McDonald —
15° a.Z. Clear + cold — Florence left in 1/4 of 2 Train — P.M. I at desk

9° a.0 very cold day Mercury falling — I went to Chh. + S.S. Mr Atkinson's morng. text John 14 — 15, 16 7 v. cl — P.M. Our redemption — Both good — Precious Sabbaths — after service wrote sister Mary —
3° b.0 very cold — I at Desk all forenoon + part of P.M. Mrs Sophronin Kempton came at 11 1/4 Train via N. Bedford — from Compton —
Ed. Lothrop died yesterday —
14° a.0 pleasant — forenoon out to store P.O. + Mr Tripps —
Mrs Kempton + us Ladies went to Bd.H at Eve.
Pleasant — Mr Wild went to Taunton on Sled with horses for coal –— Eve. We went to Tableaux + Reception by Class of 73 — a success —
Nellie + I went to Boston —
Mrs Kempton left for N.B. before us — Nellie saw Dr Clarke —
I did Banking business — snowed as we came home —
Little flurries of snow most of the day — Recd. a letter from Saml. about working for Me. —
No femal prayer meeting —
Pleasant — Geo. went to Taunton on his own act. I drove Blacky in sleigh on 3 rides with different ones —
It was mild + thawing —
Pleasant — I went to Church twice + S.S. Mr Alkinson morng. text [tab-like space] — P.M. Com. Season —
Misses Mary Briggs + Ann E. Carter were recd. into the Chh. by letter —
Comd. snowing early this morng. + continued all day — + is at Eve. Snowing — May at home not well — I wrote in P.M. + Eve sevral letters —
Pleasant but snow very deep + cars delay-ed hours — James T. Fields gave a lecture on Tennyson in Semy. 2 1/4 P.M. It was delightful — Eve. Soc. Circle for choice of officers here — 9 prest
Cold morng. but sun came out warm — Geo. Went to Taunton for coal with the horses + sled —
Nancy Cole from Fall Rivr Spent the day here + ret&ddotlow; at Eve.
Dr Plumb at Semy. at Eve. to preach —

very cold at 6 1/2 — but moderated to 36° a.0 — Lovely day — Mrs Babbitt came at 11 — Began on my Poplin overskirt — after dinner took Mrs Beane's Polinase to cut — Eve. no meetig [inkblot or crossed out first letter] Mr + Mrs Alkinson + May called here
Lovely day — Geo. went 2nd time this week to Taunton + got load of Le Prigh coal — Mrs Babbitt 1/2 day on my Pop. overskirt — No female prayer meeting —
Pleasant + sunny — Nellie has rash — Mrs B. + I rode out in sleigh nearly to Barrowsville — P.M. I sewing for Mary — She at Bdg.House or Semy. nearly all day —

Lovely day abating wind + walking – Rubber Boots needful Mr Atkinson's morng text "Those art not far from the Kingdom of Heaven — P.M. Dispise not thou the day of Small things —" Excellent the P.M. sermon —
Mild but cloudy snow I kept in house awhile – till Eve. when we went to hear a Mr Bryant ventriloquist the closing of the 8 lectures —
Nellie still sick with Erysipelus or something

Mild – Mrs Metcalf in 2 or 3 hours + dined with us. P.M. rained + wind almost to a hurricane for an hour or so — then clea&ddotlow; off — + pleasant — Eve. Mr Rogerson called to talk about Comittee + Trials
Very mild + pleasant Geo. + Lizzie went to Boston in 1/4 of 10 Train I carried them down P.M. Mrs B. + I went to Mrs Atkinson's to sew on Home Miss. Box
Eve. very tired — — —

Mrs. B. + I went to Boston Bot. me Black Striped silk + did Sundry items of shopping — we visited the Gallery of Paintings by the Misses Williams — Ret&ddotlow; at 5 1/2 — Eve. went to Semy to hear Miss Smily preach She seemed like a devoted christian —
Mild + snow wasting. I at Desk in forenoon for a while setting cash Book right —
Mrs Atkinson in to prayer meeting — Eve. Nell read "on the Elbe" in Harpr– I basted pillow cases.
Cloudy + mild — I busy about Poplin dress– in forenoon – cutting sack pattern +c — Nellie Burdett sent for to go home to her sick Father
Mary Chapin recd. today the appointment of valedictorian to her class. Mrs B. + I walkedwald in lot with Carl —
We went to Chh. also Maggie to her Chh. Very windy – Mr Atkin. morng. text Eph. 2–10– P.M. Rom. 8–18– Nellie + May out in the morng Eve. + night almost a gale —

Still windy + difficult to heat the house — Mrs Comstock came at noon – P.M. we went into Seminary to Examination – Eve. 6 young men from Providence College here to Tea — + Two spend the night — Mus. Concert at Semy —
I sick in the morng. from cold + headache — Miller + Taylor left in the morng. about 5 1/4 for cars with Emory Holman + others —
Examination in Seminary forenoon — I at house — Drs Hooker + Plumb called —
Pleasant — Mary Chapin left in Mon Train for her vacation My cold better — Drove out in P.M. with the B's + Mrs Comstock. The latter left in the 1/4 5 Train — Eve. I read the Architect of Cologne —
Cloudy morng. Mrs Babbitt here on Maggie's dress — P.M. hard snow storm —
No meeting at Eve.
Fair Day — P.M. 3 in to Form. Prayer Meeting —
Mrs Metcalf in at Eve.
Pleasant day but cold enough for fur cloaks — Mrs B. + I went to Bos. I bot. Brussels carpt + we hear the col&ddotlow; Jubilee Singers —
Pleasant — went to Chh. twice text Wilt thou not revive us again — Searching + faithful sermons Eve. wrote Martha + Miss Carter —
Mrs Briggs here cleag – My Chamber + Parlor chamber to be clead tomorrow — Sam's Room + Kitchen today Mrs Babbitt here on Poplin — P.M. rode to Sam Draper with subscription Paper Laby[?] —
Carpets for 2 Rooms shook — Drizzly day – Mrs Briggs here — got Parlor Chamber in order —
Eve. we went to Miss Whites for Social Circle Plans —
Stormy day — Mrs Briggs here — Bath R. front Entry + Stairway to Ding room — begun — I at Desk —

Fair day — took up sitting R.+ Office Carpet + put down a new carpet on my room Mrs Frank Richmond + a Mrs Otis from Taunton called early this morng + staid an hour — Mrs Briggs here cleang Her. Hus. help&ddotlow; shake cape Eve. Meeting —
Lovely day — Geo. went to Taunton for coal — Mrs Briggs cleaning Sitting Room — offices put in order — Fem. Prayer Meeting 6 present in my chamber Saml. W. Gusher came this P.M.
Geo. went to Taunton on his business – Saml help&draise; put carpet down in the hall stairs +c —
Mrs Briggs here 1/2 day –
We went to Chh. Mr Alkinson's morng text on Warfare — P.M. running a race —
Frank Hunt out all day —
Mrs Briggs here cleaning — Mrs West spent the day with us. John Rogers died last night – with apoplexy –
Pleasant – Mrs B. + I went to Boston – Did Bank&gdotlow; business bot Ding. R. Carpet + Kid Boots —
Eve. Mrs Wild in on business –
Wind in the night + very hard in the morng. – Mrs Briggs + Mrs Babbitt here The letter for Mrs Ban I busy putting Day R. in order – + other things –
Fast Day —
Mrs B. + Nellie gone to Bos. Mary Chapin came at noon — I rode with Geo. to McCabe's – then for Mary + at night for Mrs B–N – Eve. a few came in about Oyster Party
Busy all day — New carpet put down in Ding. Room — Some Pictures hung various things put up in place. P.M. + Eve. Saw Mr Rogerson Mr Freeman + Kate Wood – Miss Stickm here in the morng.

Cloudy — To Chh. twice + S.S. Choose Mr Rogerson+ Mr Frem Supt. + Ast. – Mr Akinson morng. text He that is faithful in that wh. is least is faithful in much — P.M. Home Miss. Serm. He read II Saml. 7 Ch. + text in 8– 6–14 verses –
Cloudy, + drizzly —
Wrote several letters
I busy in doing up business to leave two days –
Left in morng. Train for Ux. Via Providen reaching Ux. at 1.P.M. Found them glad to see me —
Adol. quite feeble
Pleasant — Mary Fox + children came in the P.M. to see me —
I went to Adol&sdotlow; to Tea – Bro. Judson came to our joy –
Pleasant — Left Ux. at 12–20 + reached home at 1/4 6. —
At desk till 9 1/2
Stormy – rain + snow – Mr Wild went to Boston about Chh. Upg.
Very stormy P.M.+ Eve. – Wind shaking the House –
Rainy morng — but for forenoon comfortable — Easter Sunday + there were beautiful flowers on the Pulpit — Mr At. morng. text Phil. 3–10 f.c.
I went to Taunton in noon train
Trustee meeting
Eve. Oyster Party
Mrs Babbitt here on Sisters Pop. Dress I went to get my things from vestry in the morng Drove with Cottagrs and Mrs Bea to Mr Harvy's in P.M. – after wh. the Atkinsons called.
Mrs B. went to Bos. with me Call&ddotlow; S. Bk. Div&ddotlow; –
Cloudy, threatening day but did not rain —
Rained hard in the night —
Cloudy day – Mrs B + I went to vestry early in the morng. to meet Comt. on rep Chh. Mr Haring then Mrs Babbitt here on Sister Ella*y's dress – Had many callers on business —.
Cloudy morng. + P.M. till near 4 – when it showered freely – Mrs B. + Nell were out driving with me – Mary Chapin came over in the forenoon to spend the Sab. + let me Doct. her for a cold –
Pleasant – Mr Atkinson morng. text Psl. 26–8 on love for the sanctuary P.M. Thou thotest I was altogether such an one as thyself — on the justice + mercy of God
Mrs B. + I went to Eve. meeting – Mr Rogerson + Mr Freeman comd. their duties as super***
Rather Cloudy — Geo. went to Taunton with 1 horse load of Hay – to J. Paul.
I drove to Jennys to Silas Cobbs – +c – Mrs Beane first + then Nelly rode in Buggy with me – Mrs Babbitt here –
Pleasant but cool. Mrs Babbitt here – Silas Cobb surveying Jackson Lots –
Cool– Mary Chapin + I went to Boston – saw Dr Clarke also May – bot me Sing Machine — + did Sundy things in shop for Mary – Mr Beach ordaind to day on Un. Chh.
Pleasant — went in morng. to Uni. [overwritten] Conference – Heard Ms Celia Burleigh– essay on Reverence.
P.M. drove to Watermns for Boots – Eve. to Meetig – Hired Sam's friend– Le Forrest Frank. Gleasn to come + work on farm –
Cool but pleasant Drove to see Mr Jenigs Parsonage Geo. Sweets Depot + visit – with Mary Sweet + Mrs Storm – Female prayer meeting —
Mrs Babbitt here in P.M. –
Pleasant –
Geo. went P.M. to Mansfield + Fox. try to sell Hay –
P.M. I tried the new Singer Machine Frank Gleason came to night — to begin work Monday —
Pleasant ie not stormy but windy + cool —
Mr Atkinson morng. text Matt. 5–6 – P.M. II Saml –22 ch.–
I did not go out at Eve —
Pleasant—
Geo. went to Pawtucket – to see about Horse — I took him to Lane's Depot–
Mrs Babbitt here all day — I made Deed of Jackson Lot to Seminy — Frank began work to day –
Mrs Babbitt here 1/2 day –
I very busy –
P.M. rained hard Frank worked at Dr Round's ploughing
Rainy night + Morng threateng – but cleard off pleasant Geo. went to Raynh to look at a horse Mrs Babbitt here all day P.M. I rode with Colt + Fred –
Mrs B. + I went to Boston – Did Bk &gdotlow; + Did business + Shopping very pleasant —
Mrs Babbitt here for May –
Cloudy morng. + toward began to rain – I at Desk most of the day – Mrs Babbitt here—
A.P.Goodwin here to Fem. prayer meeting
Rain from Friday forenoon on till far into this night – Florence came at noon for her vacation a week longer. Maggie miserable

Lovely day – An inch of Snow on the ground in the morng. but melted fast – We worshiped in the vestry – Chh. in repair — Mr Atkinson very interesting– morng. text Jon. 6–63 – P.M. Com. Season Eve. Miss Cochrane + others reported on Persia –
Pleasant – Mrs Babbitt here half day – Geo. caried hay[?] to No. Attleboro –
I called at Mrs Geo. Sweets + got hat – she had sewed for *** Eve. at Mr Rogerson talking about Chapel –
Pleasant – Mrs Babbitt here – Mrs B. + I went to Boston –
I bot shrubs +c
Mrs Babbitt came in morng. a little while and took work home
– Mr + Mrs Emerson came at noon –
P.M. we talked over Seminy matters
Ev. Geo. in to talk on getting a horse
Pleasant but cool – Sent Geo. with Mr Geo. Sweet to Bridgewter to find a farm horse. Trustees meet–all came to the Drawing Room. for this meeting
Mr + Mrs Emerson left in the morng. It began to rain about 8, o clk + raind steady —
Cloudy + not settled weather. Mrs Capron left in morng. Had letter about Cold–
P.M. drove to Mansfield + bot Plants — Mrs B. + Nellie with me –
Rainy last night + P.M. + Eve. We went to Chh. in vestry — Mr Alkinson's morng. text Gen. 4–9– On influence P.M. Matt.7 – 7,8,11 – all good but
Mrs Babbit here –
P.M. we drove to Mansfield to Straw Shop – Mrs B. Nellie + Mary Chapin – Eve. called on Mrs Bannister at Bd. House
Pleasant – Mrs Ban– + Mrs Metcalf here to dine – Mrs Babbitt here in P.M. –
. W. Bird called with Geo. Sweet about the colt. Lizzie Wild here to tea —
Pleasant – Mary Chapin + Ella Sterns I took to Depot for Boston– with Senior Class pictures.
Geo. went to Taunton with hay. – + was in here in the Eve.
Rev. Mrs Emory + + her sister Ann Reed called —
Pleasant – Geo. + his little Boys I took to Depot for Boston + Nellie for Taunton —
Mrs Babbitt here — Mrs Banister left— town at 11. Morg —
Sarah Sweet called at 6 1/4 I went to Depot for Geo – Eve to
Pleasant – Mrs. Babbitt here –
Forenoon Mrs Beane in Garden – I busy sewing +c – P.M. pray meeting here – after wh. I took May Atkin Mrs B. + Nellie to ride
Geo. went to Mansfield for Plants —
Pleasant – Mr Atkinson in about ventrilator – P.M. I went to Attleboro with MssCarter + Mellus Eve– Mr Freeman + Geo. Wild . —
Mostly pleasant but some sprinkling of rain – I went to Chh. in morng. + S.S. + staid at home in the P.M.
Eve wrote Bro. Austin
Rosey, her Hus. + baby came after Tea to call —
Pleasant– Mrs B.went with me to Bos. I went to vault + Bk. – + did some Shopping
Mr Blake was in the Cars going to Boston —
Pleasant– on Returns for Assessors — P.M. rode up to Mr Harvey + Geo. Arnold's –
Mrs Metcalf – Misses Mellus + Carter with me –
Finished returns + Leased deferred them P.M. took Misses Mellus + Carter – to ride – I was chilld thro. Eve felt sick –
Last night taken vomiting– had 3 seasons–
Morng sent for Dr Round —
Dr R. into see me –
Dr in to see me. Some better –
Began to take dry toast —
26&th; annivsry of our Mother's death–
I at home from illness–
Eve Dr Round called a moment –
Pleasant + lovely – Little better perhaps–
Dr Round called chg&ddotlow; med. Left Mrs + Mr. Sol. + it did one good —
Took my first ride – for a week because of sicknes –
some Stronger —
No meeting at Eve. Bugs out on May Basket hanging –
P.M. Mary Atkinson in to prayer meeting
Went to Boston to get Div&ddotlow; at Cus. House – Mrs Met. went with me. Home at noon –
Dr Round called + left med. for me to go to Ux.
Pleasant — at home till eve. when I went to Seminy to Concert on Madura Mission — Annis Lincoln's Foundry burned this morng. at 3 – by Incindiary
Pleasant – Early drove to Chh. with Mr Wild to see repairs – to Geo. Sweets Annis Lincolns Mr Hagertieys – + 1 1/2 left for Ux — getting here 1/4 of 6 —
Cloudy but P.M. Cyn. Mary + I rode to Whitunsvile + Luke Prentess Pl–
Cloudy but no rain – morng. walked to P.O. – + then to Mary Fox' Olive walked with me – P.M. Mary + family here — I rode with Will&ddotlow; for Butter —
Pleasant but + warm at 9 went to ride with Will&ddotlow; + Mary East part of the town—
P.M. over at Adol.'sMargaret Spring calld —
Pleasant + warm – Forenoon helpd May iron – there rested after wh. to P.Of. –
P.M. over to Adol&sdotlow; &longequal;
Rained in Showers in P.M. —
I went over to Adol. to Tea –
Cloudy –
went to Chh. P.M. Heard a Mr Wells of Northbridge —
Pleasant–
Sister Mary + I started for Norton in 10.55 Ex Trn via Prov. Reachd hom at 3 1/4 –
Pleasant – Mrs Bean left for Worcester Fitch– + Marboro in 11 1/4 –
Sister Mary here —
Sister Mary + I went to Boston I sat at Marshals for my Photograph
Did business got very tired
Misses Titus, Mellus, + Carter in City – to get Chh. carpets—
Very tired by busying to sweep Piazza — I rode to Esq. Perry's with Colt – P.M. went to bed No prayer meetig
Mr Cobb in to Settle up some little bills of Chh. matters —
I then rode with Nellie
Dr Blodgett cam at Eve. to preach
Rain last Eve a little – pleasant to day — Dr Blod. morng. text – 2 Con. 8–14– P.M. Exodus Be sure your Sin will find you out. very solemn –
Dr Blodgett left after breakfast – churning done – I then drove out – with Sister –
P.M. at home –
Pleasant– but dry + hot Mrs Beane retd. in 3 Train # Mary + Clara went to Taunton — # Mary Chapin) –
I drove to Depot 3 times
Sister May left in morng. via Bristol home – Mrs Beane rode with me after I ret&ddotlow; from Depot –
Geo. White in to settle &account;–
Very hot day —
Drove out after tea with Mrs Bean + Nellie —
Pleasant — I went to Boston at 8 1/4 Train + ret&ddotlow; at 3. Did shopping for Mary Chapin – Miss Goodwin in to Female prayer meeting —

Clear + cool — Mrs B. Nellie + Mary Atkinson rode with me to Chilsons Gardens— Drought heavy upon them– Geo Wild went to Taunton 1/4 of 6 morng. back 1/4 of 10 + off to Bos 11 1/4 to get up a hay Reach —
Pleasant + not hot but very dry – Mr Barry preached – morng. text 1 John 3–9 – P.M. Ecl. 12–7– immortality of the soul–
Pleasant – I car&ddotlow; wash to Bridget + then we drove thro. the neck–
P.M. at Desk several hours —
After tea playd Croqutte—
Nellie went to Tau. after Tea we rode –
Eve Mary Wild in to call —
Pleasant + cool Except mid day– hot– Busy preparing Flowers for Graduates who were here to Tea – 13– dear Mary Chapin one of them–
Mrs Metcalf here
44&th; anniversry of my marriage
Pleasant but hot– Mrs Beane + I went to Boston in 1/4 ten Train Mary Chapin came this morng. to stop – she is sick with Erysiplus on the noon I called the Dr —
Clear + warm — Took Lizzie to Depot for Boston – 8 1/4 Train then went to Bridget, for Mary's Polinase – then drove in neck woods – Dr Round here to see Mary–
P.M. Miss Goodwin in to prayer meetig–
Very warm– P.M. Thunder storm + rain— Saml. help&ddotlow; me to relay my chamber carpet + Sundry things— changed Beds —
I at home with Mary Chapin who is still sick'
Mr Alkinson at home after an absence of 2 Sabbs
Mrs B. + Nellie out all day —
Busy preparing for anniversary – went to Laundress with clothes–
Mary Chapin feeble with Erysipelus–
Rained very hard about Tea time + thro. the Eveg —
Bright fair day —
Mary Chapin able to be with her class. + read her composition + valedictory – tho. feeble.
Sis. Cynthia, Br Will. Mrs Allen, Susie Pratt Hattie Lester + Mr Emerson left to day —
P.M. I went to Prep. Lecture – then cal&ddotlow; on some of the neigbors– Mrs Met. here to Tea– Harry Barrws + wife calld —
Cloudy morng. Ellen left for Compton in 1/4 of 9 train – Frank gone to Boston– Saml.
A Pic Nic of Sam. Arthur + Geo. + Some of there grads – May C – May Bashelde + Ella Sterns came to lunch + to Tea with Winn Marole —
Pleasant– Mary Came to dinner + Tea – She is packing to leave Noonday
Jere. Bassett here cleaning clocks–
Florence came at noon –
Lovely day– Mary here – We ladies went to meeting all day – Com. Season P.M. Mrs B. + I went to 3d service —
Pleasant – I drove to Bridget's —
Mrs Babbitt here to work for me. Mary A Chapin left for 1 3/4 P.M. Train for Home with Bag. gathered for 5 years P.M. I took Geo. to Barrowsvill Depo. for Providence to repair mowr –
Mrs Beane Florence + I went to Boston also Mrs Metcalf + from there started on her journey West. I went to Cus. Hous + did other busines
Pleasant — P.M. went to Bridgets and settled Laundry Bill– Miss Carter rode with me. after wh. Mrs B. + Florence rode Mrs Babbitt here I machined in the morng. on Muslin + Basque —
Pleasant — I busy forenoon – + after Dinner regulated Drawers Some –
Mrs B. Flo. + Misses Mellus + Carter rode at 5 1/2 – Evg. we went to vesty meeting–
Went to Taunton with Miss Mellus morng – P.M. A.P. Goodwin here but I was engaged with Mrs Briggs in taking papers +c, on business — 4 P.M. rain hard out cleared at Eve
Lovely day– morng. drove to Bridgets for clothes– + then to Chartly corner–
P.M. called on Mrs Cobb + to cottage + Saw Mr Rogerson about Bdg. H. matters Geo. went to Prov. at Eve. train Miss M. +c came to Tea
cool + pleasant — I out to Chh. + S.S. Mr Atkinson's text morng. a new creation Gal. 6–15 P.M. – 1 Pet. 3–15– Give a reason of the hope that is in you –
I had a new Scholar Mrs Hussy—
Pleasant– but hot in P.M. Morng I drov to Bridget's — P.M Mrs Babbit here – I looked over rags morng. cut soap —
I left in morng. for Pawtuckut + after doing busines there I went into Prov. + then to Ux in 2 1/4 Train – very tired – Friends glad to see me —
Cloudy – Sister Mary + May Abbie + self walkedwald on to the high + had a fair view called at May Fox + Dr Bassets —
Took Tea a Cynthia Raind hard in the Evenings—
Left in 8.20 Train for Pawtucket– Rainy – went to S. Bk– + then hom in 10 1/4 train — + at house 20–11–
Mr + Mrs Craig called + Ella B***
Still rainy —
I busy at Desk on Policy – Flornce helpd me –
P.M. Mr + Mrs Craig + Benj + Ella here to Tea —
Pleasant day
Mr Craig preached in morng. Mr At. P.M – A Mrs Allen Lane in Sen. Class — [handwriting gradually becomes very shaky]
Mrs. Bean + I went to Boston I attended to sund items of business – Took carriage an hour – But became very tired on reachg home – Mrs Payson called –
Misses Mellus + Carter left this morning mrg with Mrs Payson – I took Mable Babbit and drove to Bridgets + to P.O. Mrs Babbit here for me –
Eve. we calld at the Eliots–
very hot P.M.
Hazy + hot – I drov out to see Geo. With Laby – then went Bridgets with Floren
Eve. Mrs B. Flo. + I called at Parsonage–
Morng. drove to Mansfield for Doct. Allen to come + open Geo.s abscess – M. Atkinson M. Clarke + Mrs Beane went with me.
Mrs B. + I went to vesty meeting at Eve — [handwriting different here]
Still hot + dry – I called in to see Geo. after driving to Post Office – Mrs B. + Flo drove to Bridgets – I vry busy sewing – Miss Goodwin in to Prayer meeting — Benj. Bramn here nearly 5 hours – Tea
Hot– at Desk most of the day – settling acts – making book +c – settled with Charly Lane – Adams – + made up Sundry things —
Began to rain abot 9 morng. Several thunder Showers thro. the day –
I staid at home –
Mrs B. + Flo. went P.M. Some vry sharp crackin thunder —
very warm + Sultry very busy in closig up. matters —
Showry—
I set out to go to Mrs Holman's but faild in the design–
Very hot – + Sultry–
25&th; Annivery of Mr + Mrs D.E. Holmans marrriage – she sick – Mrs Round in at Eve. + Fannie Br***[Brannen]
The hottest day of the Season, so far as our feelings go– at Desk a good while
P.M. packed —

Left 1/4 10 Train for our vacation – Mrs B. + I for N.H. via Boston. Stop&ddotlow; at Amr. House Did Bk &gdotlow; Business +c. Maggies leaves 1/4 2 P.M. House closed Save Sam W. Gusher's Rooms who lodges in the House.

Cool + comfortable – Left Amer.H. for Eastern Depot + the Depot for Shelburn[?] in 8–30 Express Train at Salem looked for Misses Mellus + Carter in vain – came to Portland + Ham[?] by Grand Trunk R.R to Shelburn – on getting there found Mellus + Carter had preceded us + found new Rooms at Berlin Falls –
70d on rising – in our room Mt. Forest Hotel – The day was warm – put on Linn[?] Lawn after we went to the Rapids —
80d during the day –
80d warm – Grenadir* Dress to Chh. Heard Mr Benedict N.Han[?] Student of last year stud on pryer 1 Tim. 2d 8– good – We rode to Berlin Mills —
Cool – Thick dress all day– walked toward Jericho – P.M. to the Falls – Many guests at the House – We are reading Middle March by George Eliot – Perfect day —

Cool – Thick dress all day – 58° in morg[choice rend?] and 72° tho. warmer in my Room – Morng. walk&ddotlow; into the woods– charming walk P.M. drove to Milan Grand view of the Mts Eve. heard of Rosy's baby's death—
Cloudy + milder air Miss Mellus not well
We had our morng. + P.M walks – some new points of interest of evry day – A Mr Edmund Rodman of N. Bedford has been sketching here – A Ms Stetson boards here from Quincy Mass.– A Teacher –
Cars late– so we went to bed with out letters – –
Drizzly– Miss Mellus better – a letter from Sister Mary this morng. that came in last night –
Cool– Miss Mellus still feeble– We Mrs B. + I walked morng. + P.M. the other Ladies took shorter walks– 22 from Shelburn here to dine–
Cool– + pleasant– We went on to the Island op. the Hotel – at 1 we went to Falls to see a Dam chopd away but was defered till 6 – we we were there again + met Anie Kilham + Sis. + Miss Hove[?] –
This is Miss Carter's 40 Birth day – She read a beautiful sermon from Norman McLeod on the birth + death of one – + return of birth days –
P.M. We went to Berlin Mills Hall to hear Mr Benedict
coolest morng. with Sis. May + Mrs Emerson
P.M. We all rode to Gorham– I Engaged Board at Dea Libby's to begin next Saturday– We had a delightful ride –
Cool– We walked in the morng. and at 1 1/2 we all went on to the Island with Mr Forist to see Mr Gray try to break away a tempory Dam– butt he was unable to do it –

Very foggy Early but it lifted + after writing letters we Started on a walk to Berlin mills and saw the variety of sawing – a gang of saws –edging– shingle + lashe making – spruce mostly – also planing, edging + tongues all at one time – also planing of clapboards – + where blocks were sawed – for paving streets –

Cloudy most of the day + P.M. we 4 set off in 3 in carryall + 1 in open Buggy with Lawrn Enroute for Lancaster – We stopd in Jefferson at Warnbeck House to dine 21 miles – + to Lancaster 8 miles &longequal; The Mt. views were grand –+ the roads bad– Lancaster a beautiful place &longequal; sprinkled some–

Rained Some in night – our Rooms numbered – mine 39 – + Miss Mellus' I think No. 40 at 7 1/2 in morng. we left Hotel for Depot – at 8 we took the cars for Groveton 8 mls in the town of Northumberland. Junction of the B.C. + M. with the Grand Trunk R.R. The latter R.R. we took for Berlin Falls 30 mls when we ard. at 10–5–

Rained in the morng. but cl&ddotlow; before 9 morng. We left in the 10–5 Train (Mrs B. + I for Gorham) + Misses M.+ C. for Salem– I have taken Room at Dea. Libby's – It grew warm – 84° when I went to bed. Our Room had a heated chimny com&gdotlow; with it – Judge Pitman + son – Frank Jimy + wife + Charly Tripp + wife from N. Bed. John Stanly + Sister + Miss Harrington of Salem — Miss Rich of Wakefield+ Miss Yeaton

Blown up cool – 19° since going to bed – Clear all day– none So clear Since we came to the Mts. We heard Rev–Apsby of Cambridge [ge underneath word, not on next line] in Rev.– Tewksbury's Chh. John.17–3– at 4 1/2 we went to a Singing meeting –

Pleasant morng. we walked with the Stanly's to Depot and then to wire Bridge crossing to Mt. Hayes – but did not go over – Here had good view of Mt. Washington– P.M. Misses Yeaton of Somervile[sp]+ Rich of Wakefield went with us to Lead mine Bridge + Gates cottage with drive[?] for views It raind coming Home —
Raind thro. last night + this morng. Mr Jemy introduced himself to Mrs Beane she had visited when he was a boy at his now deceased Parents–
P.M. We walked out but it was Sultry– I maild a letter to Geo. + Lizzie – We then walked up above Lary's + the Taw**

The Jenny party left at 7 1/2 for Mt. Washington – 6 of them – Seven of us left about 9 for the Glen + Glen Ellis — Judge Robert – Pitman + Son Rob&tdotlow; – Mr Stanley + Sister – Miss Farington[?] Mrs Bean + self – We had a nice time –
Foggy morn – wrote sister + mailed the letter – It seemd very warm out walking. Judge Pitman + Son left this P.M. [couple spaces] Lame from my jaunt to the Glen.
Mrs Bean Beloved Friends – Merrills — one of them a Mrs Pratt from Chicago–
Cloudy – The Jenny's Tripps + Mrs Rich + Miss Yeaton left in 11 1/2 up Train for B.N. Mrs B. + I went to Wire Bridge Saloon[?] in morng + P.M. toward Randolph with the Stanleys —
Cloudy morng. – 70°–

We walked out in morng. [something overwritten...hot?] Dea.s Saw Mill — + rode home with Alna– as it began to rain– but it was only a little. P.M. Isa. Eniles called to see the Ladies. I bathed at 4.P.M
Cool + dark, Savage looking clouds all day – We went to Chh in the morng. Mr Tewksbury preached the pastor 2 Cor. 13.5 – P.M. I studied the S.S. Les Eve. wrote Anne + Maria
Bright + cool. Mrs Bean + Miss Farrington went up Mt. Washington + I went to Jefferson with Mr Stanly + Sister + Drivr It was a remarkably clear day –
Pleasant– Bot. R.R.T. for going home. P.M. packed—
Then read some of Hamlet —
Pleasant– at 10 1/2 we left Gorham in Cars with the Stanley party for Portland — dining at Danbury Junc. ard. at P. about 3. took carriage for Falmouth House + then drove on to the westn Hts.
rose at 5– took Bos. + Maine R.R. Cars at 6 1/4 got Refreshments at Exeter – but were bothered with Camp meeting people –
about 9 1/2 reached Bradford + stop&ddotlow; over train to visit Seminay – + home at 5 1/2 train – Maggie came at noon.
Pleasant – we unpackd and Straightened out things. –
Mrs Harrison Lincoln called to see about her daughter Entg. Seminry – Mrs B. saw her –
Eve. Geo. + Lizzie took Mrs Tripp + Mary Wild over to D. E. Holmans Silver wedding–[underlined to separate from next entry]
very sultry – Saml. was chamber windows + I help&ddotlow; – Floren came at noon + Nellie at Eve. Mrs B. + I called at Esq. Perry's – Florence only stop&ddotlow; to dine &longequal;
Cloudy – Mrs Beane at home all day not beig wEll –
Mr Atkinson's morng. text Gen. 4–7 &longequal; P.M. Phil 1–l.c=20v — faithful – very small cong&nraise;

Sultry all day till night – Nellie left in the morng. for Compton – Mrs B. + I went to Bridget's with clothes – Then put Drawing Room in order — Mr + Mrs Atkinson called – about 5 P.M. came up a prolongd thunderstorm but cleard off at sunset

Clear + Cool + beautifu Geo. went to Taunton with Hay – We did up Tomatos – 21 qt. cans – P.M. Mrs B. + I called at A.A.Lincolns, Mr Tripp Titus' Round's – Mrs Barrows Rogerson's + Freeman's – Mrs Babbitt called on us + Fanie Brannan –
Pleasant – morng. I went to P.O. Saw Geo. on business – P.M. work on Gray dress.
After tea playd Croquett Eve. Em. Titus + Willa[?] Taft + Sister calld –
Mr Wild went in Eve. Train to N.E. Fair at Mystic Park – to stop in Boston on night.
Rainy by spells all day – Mrs Briggs here on windows + piazza – Sam. helpd P.M. prepatoy Lecture Esq. Perry died this noon aged 92 yrs next 3d Oct. — Wm. White and John Fitzgerald called on business–
+ at Eve rain [next part 1/2 on same line, half underneath] + change of wind — Mrs Beane went to to Taunton to See Dr Blake – Misses Mellus + Carter came at noon + dined + took Tea here — –
quite cool + beautiful
Misses Mellus + Carter here to breakfast — Geo. Lizzie, Mrs B. + self attended Esq. Perry's funerl Mrs Metcalf came at Eve. + came here to pass the Sabbath – by my invitation
At Church all day + Eve. went parson. to meeting – Lunch, allusion to the death of Esq Perry but none of the Family present Mrs Metcalf here
Pleasant – Mrs B. + I went Mrs Perry's in the P.M. to call – Mrs Smith + Daug just going to Cars — Mrs P. is very sad —
Cool – Mrs B. went in the P.M. to Chh. to help get the remnants of Carpet used + put dow – Laby + I drove to Mr Harvy's – Eve. Mrs B. + I called on Miss Ara Theresa Hall – an old Ux. Teacher —
Pleasant — We had Mr+ Mrs Atkinson Mr + Mrs Beach, Mrs Judd + Miss Hall here to tea – I very tired tho. we had a delightfu visit —
Pleasant —
I wrote Sister Mary – I am feeling miserable — from sore corns + weak limbs —
Pleasant
P.M. Mrs B. + I drove old Fannie by the Heny[?] Freeman place – + down by Mr Harvys
A little drizzly so we took umbrellas – Mr Alkinson's serm[tapers out] very good but I was dreadfully sleepy from bilous state of the Stomach —
Mrs Perry was out with Geo. + wife –
Pleasant – I called at Lizzie's for Baskets + then went to P.O. with Miss Mellus – P.M. wrote Hugh Cary[?] on Bos. Policies –
Then played Croquette a little while –
[ink gets lighter and letters narrower] Sprinkled in the morng. but cleard + Mrs B. + I went to Boston in 1/4 of 10 Train + back at 5 1/2
A post&ldotlow; card from Sister Mary –
Pleasant I left in 11 1/4 Train for Uxbridge via Prov. Mrs Metcalf went as far as Pawtucket I reached Ux. in 3–10 train – Sister met me on the Hill –
Pleasant – I invited Mary Chapin to return with me + she is buy getting ready –
Nellie Neile Fisher[??] + May Fox called at Sister's –
Mary + I were to lea[peters out] in 12–20 train but it poured so hard that we staid on till another day – Heavy rain –
Will&ddotlow; + Mary both seem feeble –
Cleared so much as not to rain – we (Mary Chapin + I left in 8&longequal;20 morng. Train – ard. at 12 – 10 train + found Mattie Holmes here – She cam Thursday night –
I was glad to See her
Pleasant – We all went to meeting —
Mr Atkinson morng. text on faith Hope + Charity Chaty P.M. Grim not the spirit – Eph. 4–30– good sermons – Martha + Mary went to Boarding House to Tea–

Pleasant – Mrs Holmes left in 1/4 of 10 Train for Boston – I took her her to Depot &longequal; I went for green corn – after dinner went to changing Sam. + Maggie's Beds – Mrs Swett called – we put plants on to front side Piazza — Eve. at &account; Book –
Cloudy forenoon but May Chapin + I went to Taunton and back in 11 1/4 Train P.M. She tried Jacket pattern – Mrs B. + I called at Emily Titus + Mrs Ames' —
Eve. Mrs Metcalf called.

Raind in the night + this morng. some but cleard off. I went to P.O. + called to the door of Mrs Judd with grapes — P.M. Blackey had her first drive for some 2 months pasturing we then drove Jim – with Sam.
Pleasant – Mrs Beane's 59&th; birth day — morng. I wat the Machine on Mary's Sack – P.M. Mrs B. + I called at Mrs Perry – Eve. to Mrs Atkinson + then on Mrs Payson Then to the Eve Meeting

Very lovely – Mrs Payson passed the night here + to breakfast – after wh. we took Mrs Beane to Boston to meet Nellie — Dea King called – he had chg. of the Semy. meeting Mrs Payson came to pass the night —
Lovely day – I took Mrs Payson to Depot for 1/4 of 10 Train –
Mary + I then rode to Andrew Sweet.'s – Anie Emerson + Mr + Mrs Beach called — P.M. other callers — Misses WElles of Sn&rdotlow; Class. Sam. here sick –

div.opener:
84d out of Bath Room
Sunday September 28, 1873.
div.p: Very warm – It seemd as hot as July – Mr Atkinson morng. Text Pslm. 119– 45 – I will walk in liberty – P.M. on Luke 12 chp 13 to 19 —
Saml. sick stays at home—
Warm – I went to Bridgets with clothes + then with Mary to neck woods —
Eve. Mrs Lurrmore[?] lectured on "what shall we do with our Daugh
P.M. drove out with Saml. Mrs B. + My Sister Mary + Bro. Willd came while we were out in the 3 train

Lovely day – Will&ddotlow;, Mary Mary Abbie + self left for Plymouth via Boston – Left B. in 2 1/2 Train getting to the Samoset House about 4 – went out to Plymouth rock – Coll [something smudged out]+ Burial Hill Rev Mr Harding going with us.

Another perfect day – We went to Pilgrim Hall Court House to see the old Records to the Jail – again to Burial Hill+ P.M. 3–50 left for Bos. Stop&ddotlow; at Marlboro. + Eve we all went to hear H.W. Burke– War of Busins
Pleasant– I went to our Bank with M. Abby + with her came home in 11–10 train– Will&ddotlow; + Mary went to Judson's
P.M. I drove to Bridgets Miss Mellus + Carter drivg Blky after that – I went to Depot for
Pleasant –
P.M. Drove to Em. Briggs woods with Mrs Bean + M. Abbi to get ferns – I then went to Depot for Mr + Mrs Judson in 5 1/2 Train —
Drizzly day – + yet not rain – Rev. Wm. Thayer preached on Temperance Temperan "Paul a total abstain]" P.M. Mr Atkinson Text Matt. 8–21, 22 – Good
Pleasant – Mr Beach called + Engaged So. House – I drove to Bridgets– taking the visitors –
at the Desk a good deal–
Eve. We all went to Lecture Rev. W.B. Wright on Strikes
Raind hard in the night– + is still raining–
We were all invited to Mrs Atkinson's to Tea Will&ddotlow; + May Mrs B. + M. Abbie + Self – Still raig
Threatnig morng. but I took Sister Mary + went to Boston on business – It cleard up– came home at 3. Fannie T. Seabury cam at Eve. to Board. Hous + called here –
I was glad to see her –
Blustering – I went to Taunton on Business + ret&ddotlow; on 11 1/4 Train – P.M. drovedro to Mrs Perry's– with Fany Seabury – She with Mrs Metcalf here to tea –

Pleasant – Mary + Will&ddotlow; left in morg train for home – I have enjoyed their visit very much – Mrs Beane went to Fall Rivr to see Nancy Cole – P.M. I took Miss Mellus + Mary at 1 1/2 + drove – no one to prar meeting

Pleasant– Jos.S. Adin[?] began to work – Geo. went to Bos. on his business – I very busy all day – In cellar some time sorting fruit, + arrang things – Drove' to Depot twice for Mrs B.[-looks like it is crossed out] she ret&ddotlow; from Fall River in 1/4 5 Train
Drizzly morng. but cleared off a lovely day. Mr Alkinson's morng. text in Matt. 19.29 Excellent – P.M. Text Phil. 1–23d – Good–
Eve. Mrs B. + Mary wnt to Bd. House to a meeting.

Mrs Bean went with me to Boston – I bot. Govt. Bonds + did some errands — went to Cong. House + left my Contributions to Woman's Bd. A.B.C.S M. + Chris. Evangelization Home Miss – Home in 3 train – Paid Taxes–
Pleasant– Social Circle here in the Eve. 50 present – Pleasant time–
Pleasant– went to Barrow's vill Depot for 1/2 past 8 train for Pawtucket [something crossed out] Depos.'t in Saving's Bk. + ret&ddotlow; 1/4 after 10—
Lovely day Mrs B. + I drove in fornoon for Mr Jennings to repair Cistern + afternoon we drove to No. Dighton to see Rosey–
very tired + did not go to Eve. meeting
Pleasant – Mr Wild sick with rheumatism–
Dr Vose preach&ddotlow; at Semy no one in to Female prayer meeting – At 1/4 I went to ride with Misses Mellus + Carter– + Mary Chapn
Rose early + wrote Cynthia about Mary staying another week
P.M. I took Miss Wier – Mary C. + May Wild to ride – Miss Wier stopd to tea —
Cloudy but did not rain till after we returned from meeting P.M. – Mr Atkinsons morng. text "we walk by faith + not by sight P.M. " How knowst thou wife +c" —
Dr Allen sent for in morg for Mr Wild – Sciatic attack
Rainy day – Mr Wild still sick – I packd pears– + had the grap cleared from the vines – a Small crop– I then put up packages + took out after going to Mrs Arnold– to be meas&ddotlow; for dress–

Storm ceased in the night + we have had a pleasant day – After breakfast went to look at wall to be laid – Then drove out with Miss Mellus + Beane + at 11 1/4 was at depot to bring up Rosey who spent the day – Eve. Col. Higgens lectured – Mr Wild went to Taunton with Hay–
Mrs Beane went to Taunton + bot. cloth for Home Miss. Sewing Circle– At 2 1/2 I went to Mrs Arnold's then P.M. to Mrs Atkinson to sew but was calld Home by Emory + Wm. White–

Eve. Dr Perry + friends called– Lady fainted at 1/4 of 2 P.M. Misses Mellus + Carter drove Blky – about 3 i went in to Mrs Arnolds Geo. in arranging to go to Brooklyn tomo Eve. Mrs B. + I went to *** meetig
Took Mr Wild to Depot for Taunton – then went for him at 11 1/2 and 1/4 of 5 he left for N.Y — P.M. Female prayer meeting –

Pleasant – Mrs B. Mary+ I went to Mansfield. bot Bulbs – called to see Carrie Hodges P.M. Carrie came here to spend the Sab– Mrs Metcalf Misses Melleus, Carter, Fisher, + Emory Holman + Beaches Balcom called –

Pleasant– Carrie here– Dr Perry of Exeter here to lunch – Mr Atkinsn morng. text Luke 14–28 to 32 inclusive P.M. John 14–16,17 vrs – 12 Ladies in my class–. Mr Atkinson earnest – + almost severe in the morng. Mary began inhaling oxygen
Violent rain + wind storm– Carrie Hodges here with Mary
I driving with Sewig repairing +c – Did "a heap" of finishing up –
very tired – Mr Rogersn called at Eve.
Pleasant– Carrie H. Left in 1/4 of 10 train – I took her to Depot then Mrs B. + I went to Bridgets= to Harry[?] Freemans
P.M. to Mrs Elliot's to Social Circle –

Pleasant Except windy Wheaton Allen came in 1/4 of 5 Train— Eve. Mrs B. with Wheaton called with me at Mrs Alkinson's on Mrs Johnsn + Mary Clarke – Capt. Arther Clarke from China was there – Mary Chapin was out most of the dy
Pleasant– Mrs Beane went to Fall River + ret&ddotlow; at 1/4 of 5 Train – Wheaton left in 11 1/4 Train – Geo. Wild to finish work here to night – I went to Prep. lecture at 3 P.M. to vesty
Drizzly day – Out to P.O. + at Eve. to Lecture of Maj. Dan Farragut – The last of the Sea Kings–
During the Day look&ddotlow; over Baskets + Boxes =
Pleasant – Sam. went to Taunton with load of Hay – I drove out with Miss Pike and Mrs Bean + Mary + then with Miss Bruce + Sister –
Bro. Judson came at noon to see about my oxen –
Mr Atkinson very interesting – Text "Love of the spirit – P.M. Com. Season –
I out all day + Eve. vesty nearly filled at – Eve. my Sab. clas large –
Rather raw – Mrs B. + I rode to Walpole + back carriag Sam. on his way to Judson's with the oxen –
P.M. I went to Mrs Arnolds, Mr Cobbs –
Eve. at Desk –

Pleasant but the coldest morng. of the season I went to Ealey P.O. Sam. retd. in the first train – Mrs Bean left in the 1/4 of 2 Train for Boston to see Nellie – I took her down – Eve. Mrs Metcalf cam + sat some 1 1/2 hours
At 6 wrote sister + Willd then in cellar to hav masn right Blks. +c – Went to DepotDep 3 times – carried Lizzie down + back – Mrs Beane returnd at Eve from Boston – P.M. wrote Mr Wild –
I very tired –
Clear, cool + pleasant – I took Carl + went down the Lots to look at Walls + then to new Wall, + to P.O.
P.M. in the house – read papers – at Drs' + had 4 Callers from Seminy +Miss Mells + Beggar Woman –
Coldest of the Season – I did Sundry things + went to P.O. called at store's + Miss Carter + then drove with Mary C. to Bridgets for wash – P.M. Miss Goodwin in to prayer meeting –
Raind in forenoon but P.M. held up + I drove Blky with Alfred + Miss Mellus
Mr Atkinson's morng. text Be filled with the Spirit – P.M. walking in the Spirit – very good 13 in my S.S. class –
Eve. went to Semiry to hear young ladies on China —
Very raw chilley day Saml. went with load of Hay to Taunton – I drove to Bridgets + Depot —
Eve. Prof. Churchill read – from. Nich Nicholls – Jo the St. Sweeper[?] or dying Go – Betsey + I are — Sam Lawson[?] Borrow bury*** + [serm?] in Irish Chapel
Lovely day but cold –
I took needful things to Mrs Alkinsons for Sociable – Afterward we went to Henry Leonard to carry garments + grocrys to them – Eve. I went to the Sociable – Mrs Beane not well + did not go.

Rainy morng. or rather Snow to whiten the ground that melted. Recd. a letter from Cousin Hannah Baylies + I left with Mary Chapin Mid Train for Bristol found the Cousins glad to see us. calld on Dr Shepard –

Pleasant but cold – Cous. Han. came with us in 9–10 train to Prov and at Warren a Mrs Wardwell got into cars + came with us. We attended to some Bk. business – + after lunch we parted– May + I take 1–20 Train for home–

Cold– Mrs B. went with me to show Wheelr where to cut Birches – I then went to office + Mrs Arnolds – then to ride – with Mary to Bridget's + round copper works round Crane Road hom– P.M Fem. prayer meeting– Mr + Mrs Alkinson called. Eve. at Desk —
Raw day – I busy
Mr Wild ret&draise; this morng. very feeble – still – P.M. I went in to see him–
I did some sewg on flannel petticoats
Stormy – some snow + then rain– I staid in Chh. at – Mr Atkin Text for morng. + P.M. Jer.6.16– Enquiry for the right way– faithfu sermons —
No Eve. meeting on act of Storm
Ground barily cov&ddotlow; with snow – stormy sort of day – I sewed on flanl + repd. Drawes – a letter from Sister Mary —
Eve. at Desk –

Stormy wild night was monday night– + this fornoon stormy– P.M. stormy by spells – I drove out Blky to Bridgs' Adelia Storer was married to Mr Talbot this P.M. – Eve. Mr Huntington lectured on Eng. Catherdal[?] in our course —
Pleasant– Mrs Beane went with me to Boston I went to Custom House – vault – Banks – + shopd out in 4 1/2 Train —
P.M. Took Mrs B. + Mary to Depot for Taunton + went for them at 1/4 of 5 –
Eve. P.Card to Mrs Beane Say Nancy Cole is worse– Mary made Mrs B. a Bonnet at Eve – I went to meeting – Subject Geth Semne–
Morng. Mr Wild took Mrs B. to Depot for Fall Rivr – + then went for Clothes–

at 1 1/2 I took Misses Mellus + Carter to ride till 1/4 of 3 – Mrs Atkin Miss Goodwin + Mrs Barrows in to prayer meetig – Maj Holman calld to borrow money – Eve. Concrt by B.U. Glee Club at Semy – a Mr Goodman here to tea + spend the night
Mary Chapin – 22 – left at 11 1/4 Train + Nellie Beane cam at 12–10 Train – I tired and not quite well – Eve. Nell. + I walked toward Depot for Mrs Bean but she did'nt come –
Pleasant day – I went to to Chh. in morng Mr Atkinson text yea the light of the world – I had 12 S.S.S. P.M. I staid at home not feelg well —
Ground covd with snow on my rising – but turnd to rain – Drizzly day – Mrs B. ret&ddotlow; at Morng Train from Fall Rivr Misss Cole died Sat Eve.
Gloomy kind of weathr cold —
Still cold – P.M. I drove out with Mrs B. + Nellie – Florence came at Eve. Train to keep Thanksgiving with us.
Pleasant day but cold – Mr Alkinsn text in Danl. 4–34,35 Good – Eve. we went to Boarding House –
Clear + cold – we drove out in forenoon – P.M. Female Prayer meeting –
Mr Atkinson called to see Flo. + Nellie with Mrs Atkinsn
coldest morng. Pleasant–
Florence left in 11 1/4 Train —
P.M. Mrs B Nellie + I drove out –
Settled with Saml. 8 months up.
Cold– Went to Chh. + Sab. School –
Mrs Bean + I went to Boston – I bot Govt. Bonds– + did other business – Home in 5 1/2 Train. Coldest of the season
Rainy +snow by spells – but by Eve. held up so much that we went to Bishop Clarke's Lecture on American Manr + habits
Mr + Mrs Wild took tea with him at Mrs Atkinsn
Snow getting Stopp P.M. I went to ride with Miss Stanton Mrs B. + Nell. Saml. W. Gusher left this morng. for Home –
Drizzly morng. but mild – I went to Taunton to have my velvet Hat remade Cous. Han. + Mary Baylies came in noon train to pass Several days P.M. Windy + rainy by spells —
Pleasant + mild– Nellie left this morng. for Milford N.H. to begin to teach. I went Neck wood with Geo. in Buggy to look at the wood in [in?] referen to cutting P.M. Fem. Prayer meeting
I kept house from cold —
Hann. + Mary rode with Geo.
Letter from Sister Margaret —
Lovely day – I kept house – cold bad –
Miss Mellus called
Pleasant– tho. cloudy I still confined in the house cold broken –
Drizzly day –
wrote Sis. Margt. + others
Eve. we read Arther Bonnicastle
Pleasant – I drove out with the Cousins + Mrs B – After our return my Birth day Picture fell from cord breaking —
This the 5&th; day I have been Shut up in house —
Mrs B. + I went to Bos. in 8–20 Train but it snowed at noon and we came out in the 3 Train–
Storm of yesterday turned to rain + it is dark + drizzly– A.P.Goodwin came into prayer meeting.
Rainy day —
Mr Wild went for wash—
Pleasant– Mr Atkin morng. text Ex. 4–13 + Isa. 6–8 combind– very good. P.M. Psl.145–10 on praise– Good–
[underline for separation] Prof. Agassiz died I think this Eve about 10&th; – wrote from recollection in Full[?] after – Later it is right–
Pleasant– rose Early telegraphed Mr Emen[?] + wrote Letters to send to Bos. Sent Geo. to Taunton for Pic. Glass– Took the Cousins out to ride – P.M. 3 Train Mr Emerson came to Trustee meeting —
Eve. Rev. Mr Spaulding lectured on Rome

Mary Alkinson ret&ddotlow; this morn Pleasant– Trustee meetg I went in to Miss Carters]Class — P.M. Mr Johns[?] Chase called– Mr Emerson left in the P.M. Mrs B. + I calld at Mary Alkinsons –from abroad
Foggy forenoon – Mr Wild helpd rehang Pictures – + P.M. Mrs B. + I rehung some– then read Draxar Miller – Misses Mellus + Carter called–
Another foggy mong. I busy about pears +c – P.M. drove out with the Cousins + Gerty Mellus – after wh. we read Architect of Cologe. Eve wrote Some —
Mrs Beane + I went to Boston
It rained in the P.M.
[unknown mark] Mr Emerson came at noon. I gave him Pay Att Miss Mellus + fanny drove Blacky after wh. I took Took the cousins out to ride + Maggy to Confessin # to vote for me in T.Br.R.R. meeting–
At home with my blind Cousin May P.M. went to Chh. Mr Atkins text Ex. I beseech thee show me thy Glory["over underline] vry good – Mrs Beane went at Eve. to Chh–
Pleasant– at 20 of 11– I left with the Cousins Han. + May for Lane's Depot for Providen – then we met Bristol Ladies who assistd them– I retd at 5 1/2 Train
Looked like snw all day–
Maggy left in 1/4 of 2 Train– for Home for one week –
Morng. at store – Eve. Mrs B. + I did up x mas gifts–
Pleasant beautiful – Mrs B. + I busy doing Housework– Busy P.M. getting Christmas gifts red for the tree – Eve. we went to the vestry – 2 trees looking brilliant + loaded with gifts —
Cloudy + mild– morng. put up wreaths +c – on my feet all the time – Florence came at noon – P.M. went to Mrs Arnold's – Eve Mrs B. + I to cottage
Drizzly between Snow + rain– very busy in the Kitchen forenoon + P.M. helping hang + put Brackets under[?] mirrors–
no prayer meetg
Busy till P.M. about house Tanton man came to look at + bot. Hay–
Geo. rode to Taunton bot apples + sundries[?] – Mr Alkinson calld this morng.

Snow storm in forenoon – 2 womn + 4 men out. P.M. no servic Mrs B. + I at home – I enjoyed the day greatly – I read Watts Pslms wh. brot up my child hood + read "Hidden Life" + Bible – Floren went out in the forenn
Pleasant– + the 6 inches of snow looks beautifully – Forenoon doing my part Kitchen work P.M. Mrs B. F. + I rode I then took Mrs Daris + Miss Carter to ride
Lovely day – Mrs B. Flo. + drove out in sliegh aroud Bouan Corner –
Maggie did'nt
at 10 Eve. 8° a.0.
Another lovely day Maggie returd at noon –
Misses Mellus + Carter + Mrs Daris here to Tea —
The year closes in mercy –
a letter Bro. Austin
Amer. + Forg&ndotlow; "Christ, world paid for in advance till 1878– – Five years from Jan 1873,

text.back:
Memoranda
Caroline Smith 1873. Feb. 19. 3, o'morng. Caroline Smith – died at Saml. Holman's age 42 yrs [space here] months–
Mrs Shelly March 10 Mrs Shelly died– Bell Struck 69—
Hon John Rogers Mar. 31 1873died Hon John Rogers of Mansfid of Apoplexy–
Lemuel Perry Esq Sept. 4&th; died this noon He would have been 92 years on the 3d Oct. next —
Prof Agassiz Dec 14 Evg. Prof. of Cambrige H.U. the beloved + honored man– died&longequal; He was born 28&th; May 1807 of French parentage in Switzerland
&ebwdiaback;
